name: workstream
title: Workstream
description: Quick switcher for VS Code windows with git status, PR info, Claude Code integration, and Chrome tab search
author: adamhancock

preferences.name: codeFolder
preferences.title: Code Folder
preferences.description: Default folder containing your git repositories (e.g., ~/Code)

preferences.name: devDomain
preferences.title: Dev Environment Domain
preferences.description: Domain suffix for development environments (e.g., myproject.localhost)

commands.name: index
commands.title: Switch VS Code Window
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Switch between VS Code windows and see git status, PR info, and Claude Code sessions

commands.name: create-worktree
commands.title: Create Worktree
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Create a new git worktree with automatic setup and VS Code integration

commands.name: cleanup-environments
commands.title: Cleanup Dev Environments
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Bulk close VS Code windows, tmux sessions, and Caddy routes for merged/closed PRs and old worktrees

commands.name: open-dev-environment
commands.title: Open Dev Environment
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Quick access to open your Caddy-hosted development environments in the browser

commands.name: chrome-tabs
commands.title: Search Chrome Tabs
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Search and switch between Chrome windows and tabs

commands.name: set-chrome-profile
commands.title: Set Chrome Profile
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Select which Chrome profile to use when opening dev environments and PRs

commands.name: open-active-dev-instance
commands.title: Open Active Dev Instance
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Open the active VS Code window's dev environment in Chrome (or switch to existing tab)

commands.name: open-spotlight-environment
commands.title: Open Spotlight Environment
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Browse and open spotlight environments in Chrome with smart tab detection

commands.name: open-pr-in-chrome
commands.title: Open PR in Chrome
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Open pull requests in Chrome with smart tab detection - switches to existing tab or opens new one

commands.name: setup-caddy-route
commands.title: Setup Caddy Route
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Configure Caddy routes for instances with running dev servers but missing configuration

commands.name: cleanup-stale-worktrees
commands.title: Cleanup Stale Worktrees
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Remove stale git worktrees (merged/closed PRs, missing directories, locked worktrees)

commands.name: start-dev-environment
commands.title: Start Dev Environment
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Start a development server in a tmux session with automatic package manager detection

commands.name: view-dev-logs
commands.title: View Dev Environment Logs
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: View and search tmux dev environment logs with live tail, filtering, and export options

commands.name: terminal-switcher
commands.title: Switch Terminal
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: Quick switcher for VSCode integrated terminals with live command tracking via zsh hooks

commands.name: event-viewer
commands.title: View Workstream Events
commands.subtitle: Workstream
commands.description: View all workstream events in real-time with timeline view and filtering by workspace

scripts.prepublishOnly:
echo "

It seems like you are trying to publish the Raycast extension to npm.

If you did intend to publish it to npm, remove the \`prepublishOnly\` script and rerun \`npm publish\` again.
If you wanted to publish it to the Raycast Store instead, use \`npm run publish\` instead.

" && exit 1
